Package glf.statemachine

Class StateMachine

java.lang.Object
glf.statemachine.StateMachine
Direct Known Subclasses:
MXStateMachine
public class StateMachine
extends java.lang.Object

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static interface  StateMachine.Action
    If the transition from one state to another has an StateMachine.Action associated with it, the Action's StateMachine.Action.act(Transition) method is invoked when the transition occurs.
    static interface  StateMachine.Event
    A tagging interface for Events that trigger Transitions.
    static interface  StateMachine.TimedEvent
    Implemented by events that must be processed by a specific point in the state machine's life cycle.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static java.lang.String WILDCARD_EVENT
    If this Event is used in a transition from a given state S, then when an Event is received while the StateMachine is in S, and there are no transitions whose Event matches the input, then the WILDCARD transition is invoked.

  • Field Details

    • WILDCARD_EVENT

      public static final java.lang.String WILDCARD_EVENT
      If this Event is used in a transition from a given state S, then when an Event is received while the StateMachine is in S, and there are no transitions whose Event matches the input, then the WILDCARD transition is invoked. If one thinks of the transitions from a state as being implemented by a switch statement, the WILDCARD event is the "default:" block.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • StateMachine

      public StateMachine​(java.lang.String name, java.util.Set<Transition> transitions, State startState)
      Construct a StateMachine that has the specified name, transitions, and initial state.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the state machine
      transitions - the transitions that compose the state machine. Note that the set of states is infered from the transitions.
      startState - the initial state of the machine

    • StateMachine

      public StateMachine​(java.lang.String name, State startState)
      Construct a StateMachine with a name and an initial state. Transitions must be added.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the state machine
      startState - the initial state of the machine
      See Also:
      addTransition(Transition)

    • StateMachine

      public StateMachine​(java.lang.String name)

  • Method Details

    • setStartState

      public void setStartState​(State s)
      If the state machine was created w/out a specified start state, it can be specified (or changed) by this method. Will have no effect if the state machine has already been started.
      Parameters:
      s - the initial state for the state machine

    • addTransition

      public void addTransition​(Transition t)
      Add transitions to the state machine. This method can be invoked at any point, even after one has begun to execute the state machine.
      Parameters:
      t - a transition from one state to another

    • getCurrentState

      public State getCurrentState()
      Obtain the current state of the state machine
      Returns:
      the current state

    • begin

      public void begin()
      Causes the StateMachine to enter its initial state. If this method is not invoked, the state machine will enter its start state when the first input is received. While it is only necessary to invoke this method if the state machine itself initiates processing, it is good practice to invoke it.
      See Also:
      receive(Event)

    • receive

      public void receive​(StateMachine.Event event)
      Events trigger state transitions in the state machine. If begin() was not invoked on this machine, the start state is entered before the first event is processed.
      Parameters:
      event - the Event that is the next input to the StateMachine. If the input triggers a Transition, the Transition's action is invoked and the StateMachine will enter the next state.

    • getTimeoutEvent

      public StateMachine.TimedEvent getTimeoutEvent()
      Obtain a timeout event that will expire after the next transition.
      Returns:
      a timeout event named "TIMEOUT".
      See Also:
      getTimeoutEvent(String)

    • getTimeoutEvent

      public StateMachine.TimedEvent getTimeoutEvent​(java.lang.String name)
      Obtain a timeout event with a specific String identifier that will expire after the next transition.
      Parameters:
      name - the name assigned to the event.
      Returns:
      a timeout event with the specified name.
      See Also:
      getTimeoutEvent()

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object

    • setVerbose

      public void setVerbose​(boolean v)

    • getTransitionCount

      public long getTransitionCount()
